intro: Exochanthus dolichocaulos, commonly known as the long-stemmed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, though it is not closely related to those plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, sprawling stems and small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
